summary: This document is a travel authorization request and itinerary for two Assistant United States Attorneys (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York to travel to London from October 12-17, 2020. The purpose is to interview a UK-based witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, described as a former employee/associate of a target who can corroborate victim testimony. The request includes a flight itinerary, security training certification, and a detailed foreign travel questionnaire.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Sent an email on September 30, 2020, seeking approval for travel to London to interview a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Steffany Rivera-Smith
persons.context: Mailing address contact for ticket delivery for the travel itinerary.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the memorandum requesting approval for foreign travel for the AUSAs.

persons.name: Jonathan Pelletier
persons.role: Acting Chief Financial Officer, Executive Office of U.S. Attorneys
persons.context: Recipient of the travel authorization memorandum from Audrey Strauss.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation concerns criminal conduct undertaken by him and his associates, specifically the transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the investigation, holding citizenship in the US, UK, and France.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: A citizen of the United Kingdom to be interviewed in London. Described as a former employee/associate of a target and a potentially valuable witness.

connections.description: Alison, an AUSA, is traveling to London to interview and debrief witness Jane Doe as part of the Epstein investigation.
Both are subjects of the same investigation into criminal conduct involving the transportation of minors.
Jane Doe is described as a former employee and/or associate of a target of the investigation, which includes Ghislaine Maxwell.
Audrey Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is authorizing and submitting the travel request for AUSA Alison.

events.title: Travel to London for Witness Interview
events.description: Two AUSAs depart New York for London to conduct in-person interviews with a UK witness in the Epstein case.

events.title: Return from London
events.description: The AUSAs are scheduled to return to New York from London after completing witness interviews.

events.title: High Threat Security Overseas Seminar Completion
events.description: An individual (likely one of the traveling AUSAs) completed the required HT401 High Threat Security Overseas Seminar training.

events.title: Initial Travel Approval Request
events.description: AUSA Alison sends an email seeking initial approval for travel to London to interview a witness in the Epstein investigation.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: In October 2020, SDNY prosecutors traveled to London to interview a UK witness described as a former employee/associate of a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The witness was considered critical, able to significantly corroborate victim testimony and provide information needed to meet elements of the crimes under investigation (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423).
The witness refused to be interviewed by video due to the sensitivity of the subject matter, necessitating in-person travel by the prosecutors.
The travel authorization explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a subject of the investigation into violations including the transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity.
The document includes a detailed foreign travel questionnaire and security training certification, highlighting the formal procedures for official DOJ travel related to this sensitive investigation.
